Articles.Content: Yeah and Git Hub still not working ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif) I dont know what can be causing this but I'll try to do it manually from the website or to use another download point but that will break CKAN
I don't use CKAN exclusively so that doesn't matter to me

Updated to latest version of CC and MM and 0.22 of Base Construction but still have same error after reloading contracts:

CONTRACT\_GROUP [baseMaintenance] 

 CONTRACT\_TYPE [baseCrewRotation]

 REQUIREMENT [CompleteContract]

 [ERROR] ContractConfigurator.CompleteContractRequirement: ContractType: 'CrewRotation' must either be a Contract sub-class or ContractConfigurator contract type

Copy of latest Output.Log below

[https://drive.google.com/file/d/0Bx3-stuGaWnPaE05YU9hdDFSSGs/view?usp=sharing](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0Bx3-stuGaWnPaE05YU9hdDFSSGs/view?usp=sharing)

Looks like a bug in CosmoBro's config to me - CrewRotation is specified when I think it should be BaseCrewRotation.

> 
> Looks like a bug in CosmoBro's config to me - CrewRotation is specified when I think it should be BaseCrewRotation.

It should. I changed this a while ago as it was interfering with KSS.

> 
> Looks like a bug in CosmoBro's config to me - CrewRotation is specified when I think it should be BaseCrewRotation.

Thanks Nightingale - I almost feel like a coder now - config changed and the contract is now green in configurator ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Looks like a bug in CosmoBro's config to me - CrewRotation is specified when I think it should be BaseCrewRotation.

I've got this installed (through CKAN) and I'm not getting any missions. Any ideas how I could help debug that?

> 
> I've got this installed (through CKAN) and I'm not getting any missions. Any ideas how I could help debug that?

Well, first of all can you clarify what you mean by "I'm not getting any missions" - do you mean from this pack? Or at all?

If it's the former, you can press Alt-F10 and expand the contact pack/missions until you see "requirement". Then click "force check requirements" - if they are all green, be patient. Any yellow means that these are unmet requirements. If you mouse over them, it will tell you what you need to do to meet the requirement.

Hi there, I am also finding that none of the missions from this pack are being offered, there appear to be a few errors in the contract configurations which is causing exceptions to be thrown by contract configurator. I have only 266 of 275 contracts loading from the packs I have installed, there appear to be issues with both the BaseConstruction and UnmannedContracts packs.

Here is a snippet from my KSP.log showing the errors being thrown regarding BaseConstruction, however I do not fully understand what I need to do myself to fix these contracts, so i'm hoping you can roll these into your next update. (I just did a search across my whole Contract Packs folder using Notepad++ to find which files these errors seem to be coming from)

This doesn't directly impact my current playthough, i'd like to have these contracts available, but it's not the end of the world if it takes a while ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

P.S.

I'd have to stitch together many many screenshots to show you the ALT+F10 output. But if it's more helpful to you then i'll do that if you wish. It's mostly green, with some yellow entries all relating to the errors that appear in ksp.log, but since the errors are from the BaseScan section, I assume that is why I get no base creation type contracts, as scanning is surely the first step

Hi again,

3 days ago I got the Scan contract for the first time but now it is gone again. Same situation since weeks. No contracts generated from the base construction pack. ALT-F10 shows the base-scan contract yellow. I thought maybe because of the upadate of CC to 1.7.3 but going back to 1.7.2 did not solve the problem.

I think I've discovered a bit of a issue. So I landed a rover on Minmus and waiting for a few days to get the base creation contract. Must have declined 100 contracts trying to get it to show up.

Wasn't sure what was wrong as I clearly had a rover landed. Then it struck me... I landed a rover, but I had two probe cores, one for the rover and one for the lander. The rover was a subassembly of the lander. So I'm theorizing that the define = BaseRover was applied to my lander (which isn't landed, it took off after landing the rover in order to provide sat coverage for RT2).

I have no idea if this can be changed so that it doesn't happen. Maybe a caution in the first post to not land this way would be good.

Anyway, I'm going to test my theory and land the lander and see what happens. Otherwise I guess just make a new one.

> 
> I think I've discovered a bit of a issue. So I landed a rover on Minmus and waiting for a few days to get the base creation contract. Must have declined 100 contracts trying to get it to show up.
> Wasn't sure what was wrong as I clearly had a rover landed. Then it struck me... I landed a rover, but I had two probe cores, one for the rover and one for the lander. The rover was a subassembly of the lander. So I'm theorizing that the define = BaseRover was applied to my lander (which isn't landed, it took off after landing the rover in order to provide sat coverage for RT2).
> 
> I have no idea if this can be changed so that it doesn't happen. Maybe a caution in the first post to not land this way would be good.
> 
> Anyway, I'm going to test my theory and land the lander and see what happens. Otherwise I guess just make a new one.

Yeah, in Contract Configurator when an undock event happens for a defined vessel, I have to make a decision which of the two vessels to keep tracking. In the situation where the two vessels completed them as one vessel (ie. it's not the case where a vessel got defined, and then docked to something else), I have no way of knowing which is the "right" choice, so I go with the one that kept the ID from before the undock (which is typically the one with the root part).

There's nothing I can easily do to solve this in CC. Best bet is to have the contract do a check for vesselType = Rover, although KSP may decide to automatically make your lander a rover before you touch down, or the player may not know/understand they need to change the vessel type of the vessel (too many people don't really read the contract parameters). To make it even worse, the UI for changing a vessel type is horribly unintuitive (double click name in info panel of map view, or right click a random probe core and hit rename).
I could probably just edit the save file and change the identifiers around right, I believe that is the name and PID to be swapped?

> 
> I could probably just edit the save file and change the identifiers around right, I believe that is the name and PID to be swapped?

Yup, that would do it. You can also change the id in the ContractVesselTracker scenario module in the save file.

Just wanted to follow up and say that changing the PID/name around did work just fine. I got the contract a little bit after I loaded the save so all good there.

I got two pieces of feedback though.

1. Can you please remove the deadlines from your contracts that could potentially be targeting a planet that takes years to get to? Or figure out some way to scale the deadline on distance. For the base I'm currently building it isn't a problem. But a base on a outer planet would not be possible within your contact deadlines specifically any of the outer planets added by planet packs. Some of these take 5+ years to get to.

2. Failure funds is pretty harsh considering the advance funds are almost non-existent. For instance, I got a contract to Minmus. Advance funds were a few thousand, but failure was something along the lines of 300k. This could really bite someone especially in relation to my first feedback point.

Hi!

I just read through a lot of issues with the first contract not showing up, same problem here. Can you tell in words what is required? I just checked the debug menu for contracts, Alt+F10. Here is a screenshot: [http://imgur.com/CDvPllK](http://imgur.com/CDvPllK)

A lot of PARAMETER [REACHSTATE] are yellow, no idea why, some others are green. Then there is a requirement for an orbit around Moho? This is displayed in the screenshot. Does the contract require a orbit around moho? I am not sure why the contract is not showing up now. Unmet requirement or a bug? I couldn't tell from the previous posts.
